intro: Onosma suffruticosa, commonly known as the Persian balm, is a perennial shrub native to the temperate regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring woody stems and aromatic, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or semi-arid environments. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional medicine for digestive and anti-inflammatory purposes.
